column4: Hi everyone... I'm having an issue where I get a kernel panic every time I try logging into unity (http://imgur.com/txZ41).  This is only a problem with unity, I can log into ubuntu classic just fine.  This problem is new (~2 days) and until an hour ago only happened every once in a while.  Now I have a 0% chance of logging into unity.  Does anyone know about this issue?  Googling gives nothing!
It's most likely a graphics driver issue. Which are you using?
it is just the internal video card for the i5... although even in ubuntu classic opengl works just fine and it is using the same driver
You can export compiz settings in ccsm>Preferences to save them
so... what do you think is going on then? because it seems to me that the graphics driver is working just fine
First, what makes you think it's a kernel panic?
http://imgur.com/txZ41 (picture of my computer after... granted it doesn't say kernel oops so it may be some other sort of panic)
on further inspection, it says avahi-daemon is tainted... i think this was recently updated... maybe a reinstall on it?
I'm willing to bet it's a problem with the intel drm module
Try a different kernel version if you can or get more specific support in #intel-gfx
what would i do to use a different kernel version? just install the right  linux-image-* package?
That's one way I guess.. but typically most kernels in a ubuntu distro are pretty much the same version..
ok, cool... i'm going to first try messing with avahi and then try downgrading the kernel
i'll be back in a bit to report what's going on
good idea
so... `sudo apt-get --reinstall install avahi-daemon` fixed everything up
unity still takes forever to load... but it loads
Oh cool
one question... how can i force ubuntu to check my disk on the next boot?
I think that was something to do with wireless networking
There's a way to do it but I don't know right off hand
it's more like configurationless routing... it doesn't automagic network mapping (it's basically apple's bonjour)
that's all good... i'll look it up
